result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case scheduled in response to violation report. Case staffed off the record.
Statements by parties. Court holds colloquy with defendant. Court reviewed expectations of treatment court with defendant. Court ordered case to remain calendared for review hearing on 10-27-2022 at 2:30 pm, Branch 17.

Case scheduled for DTC staffing and hearing on violation, 10-24-2022 at 3:15 pm, Branch 17. 
Parties notified.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE 1

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant * points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich appeared by video for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for hearing. Court in receipt of a Justice Point report. Court addressed the report with parties. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for a review hearing on 10/18/2022 at 8:30 am, Br 17.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defense provided update regarding defendants status. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in court by video.  Attorney Amanda Parent in court for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract. SANCTION: Court ordered 4 days in jail, IMPOSED but STAYED.  Court  vacates 10/06/2022 review hearing date and ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 21.
Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in court.  Attorney Amanda Parent in court for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court addressed the defendants' compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in court.  Attorney Amanda Parent in court for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court to address non-compliance issues. Defendant discharged from programming. Statements made by parties. Court ordered 1 day sanction to be imposed and stayed. Defendant to comply with deferred prosecution agreement. Case remains calendared as previously set for review hearing on 09/30/2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski appeared by video.  Attorney Dawn Rablin for Amanda Parent in court for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
DTC - ORIENTATION PHASE 

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 2 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Turn over to JusticePoint for placement. Upon placement bail to convert to $250.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent appeared by video for Ralph Norman Kinski.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
1441B Theft: Penalty Factors  WIS JI - Criminal
1441 Theft  WIS JI - Criminal
Received and Filed.
Drug Treatment Court Contract, received and filed.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in court with Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Slomczewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative that it be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Dollar General -Historic Mitchell
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Ralph Norman Kinski in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
